titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Northern Virginia Oral History Project collection, 1958-1996
titlestmt.subtitle: Northern Virginia Oral History Project C0030
titlestmt.author: Eron Ackerman

publicationstmt.date: 2006 By George Mason University Libraries. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from being created directly into EAD, created by Eron Ackerman, February 2009

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Northern Virginia Oral History Project collection
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections and Archives C0030

archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.unittitle: Northern Virginia Oral History Project collection
did.abstract: The collection contains 96 taped interviews of Northern Virginia residents. Transcripts or abstracts accompany most of the recordings. Topics such as agriculture, development, education, health, politics, transportation, and religion, with respect to Northern Virginia in the 19th and 20th centuries, are discussed.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to research although some interviews may have restrictions.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There may be use restrictions on some of the interviews.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Northern Virginia Oral History Project collection, Collection #C0030, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The collection was previously housed in the Fairfax County Library from 1962-1983. It was transferred to George Mason University Libraries in 1984.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by the Fairfax City Regional Library in 1992. Additional interviews added in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed in February 2009 by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Northern Virginia Oral History Project Collection is comprised of interviews conducted between 1962 and 1983. The interviews document community and family life, and careers in the Northern Virginia Area as well as changes in Northern Virginia since World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 96 taped interviews of Northern Virginia residents. Transcripts or abstracts accompany most of the recordings. Topics such as agriculture, development, education, health, politics, transportation, and religion, with respect to Northern Virginia in the 19th and 20th centuries, are discussed.

The eighty interviews in Series 1, taped between 1958 and 1983, document community and family life, careers, etc. in the Northern Virginia Area. The sixteen interviews in Series 2, conducted in 1982-1983, deal primarily with changes in Northern Virginia since World War II. The transcripts are in Series 3. Series 4 contains the Northern Virginia Leadership Project interviews. Roy Rosenzweig, a professor in Mason's History Department, supervised the final phase of the project. The Northern Virginia Leadership Project is a collection of interviews with prominent figures from the Northern Virginia area. The collection includes 9 interviews conducted between the years 1990 and 1996.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds many other oral histories about Northern Virginia, particularly Reston, Virginia.
